summary: This is a memorandum from the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General documenting a voluntary interview conducted on August 5, 2021, with a General Maintenance Worker at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview is part of an official OIG investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein. The document includes attachments such as the interview transcript and related forms.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation into his death while housed at MCC New York.

events.title: OIG Interview of MCC Maintenance Worker
events.description: Senior Special Agent and Special Agent from the DOJ OIG conducted a voluntary interview with a General Maintenance Worker at MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Facilities Manager Out of Office Notification
events.description: Email regarding an automated out-of-office message for the Facilities Manager at MCC New York.

events.title: MCC New York Camera Issues Service Request
events.description: SigNet service request submitted regarding camera issues at MCC New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted an interview on August 5, 2021, with a General Maintenance Worker at MCC New York as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
The interview was recorded and transcribed, with the transcript and related documents attached to the memorandum.
The memorandum references a SigNet service request on August 8, 2019, regarding camera issues at MCC New York, which may be relevant to the investigation.
The document explicitly states it contains no recommendations or conclusions and is restricted from distribution outside the receiving agency.
